text: Okay, let's have her prepare the ingredients.

Make a grid shaped pattern
on both sides of the 'konjac.'

Cut 'konjaku' into triangles
and boil it briefly.

Peel the skin of the 'daikon radish'
and cut into half moons.
Make a cross shape cut, on one side of the daikon.

Microwave it, until a bamboo skewer
easily goes through the surface.
Cut the potato with the skin, in half.
Cut the deep-fried tofu, in half.
Cut the sliced pork, into one (1) inch pieces.
Cut the 'Welsh onion' thinly and diagonally.

Split the 'Shimeji' into small pieces
and cut 'enoki mushrooms.'
Cut the rice cake into four (4) pieces.
Cut the 'Fried Fish and Tofu Cake' in half
Cut the 'Hanpen' which is a fish minced and steamed.
That's all for the cutting.

Next, let's parboil the fried fish and tofu cake
to make them easy to soak with broth.
For the same reason, parboil the deep-fried tofu and remove the oil with the kitchen paper.
Now, let's make cabbage rolls.
Cook the cabbage leaf in boiling water.

Cook the root part of the spinach first
and squeeze tightly.
Remove the firm stalk of the cabbage.

Place the spinach on the cabbage leaf
and roll tightly.

Stick the Bamboo Skewers into the cabbage roll
every one (1) and a half (1/2) inches.
Make cuts between the Bamboo skewers.

Stick the Bamboo skewer into the 'Hanpen'
and the fried fish and tofu cake.

To make the soft boiled eggs,
add a small amount of vinegar,

and gently place the eggs,
which was kept at a room temperature.

Boil about six (6) minutes
and soak the eggs in icy water.

Remove the egg shells
and cut lengthwise in half (1/2).

Let's make 'takarabukuro'
which means, treasure bag.

Put the rice cake, sliced pork, 'Welsh onion'
and the mushrooms in the deep fried pork pouch.
Close the pouch with a toothpick.
That's all for the preparation.
Let's start cooking!
Here is the soup stock.

Put the seaweed in an earthen pot
and strain the stock, to remove the bonito flakes.

The stock was made by soaking edible kelp
and thick dried bonito flakes, in water overnight.

Add the Mirin, soy sauce,
konjac and Daikon radish
and cook about 30 minutes at a low heat.

Add the 'takarabukuro', potato and
small fried-fish and tofu cake
and cook 15 more minutes.

At the end, add the Bamboo skewers,
with a cabbage roll and soft boiled eggs.
and cook five more minutes.

Daikon Radish, soft boiled eggs, cabbage rolls,
Hanpen, fried-fish and tofu cake and potatoes.

Oden, is one of the most popular
dishes in Japan, in winter.

It might be difficult to find some of the ingredients.
But, I hope you try it yourself.
Good luck in the kitchen!
